page.title: 02THE ICE-AGE IN THE AREA
page.content: During the Ice-age ,there was at some stage a vast barrier of ice to the east of the river Breamish.This prevented the escape of river/melt-water.Water built up into the valley forming a vast lake.As one travels up the valley today you can clearly see the shore-line of this glacial lake.The water actually flowed out of the lake at the nearby village of Powburn,through a deep glacial overflow channel and into a similar lake in the neighbouring valley.Nowadays,the Breamish flows into the Till,then the Tweed before entering the North Sea at Berwick-upon-Tweed
